result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Chavez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IF REVOKED: Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program, but IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.

Register with Sex Offender Registry.
Sex Offender treatment is up to his Agent.
No contact with any minors unless consent is provided by his Agent.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victim or her family and residence.
Provide DNA sample if not yet previously done.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - With Huber, release for work, school and physical treatment.

Defendant Anthony J Chavez in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. State presents statements. Defense counsel presents statements. Court imposed the following sentence:

     The Defendant was given the following:

WITHHELD SENTENCE;

TERM OF PROBATION:  5 YEAR(S);

 CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Register with the Sex Offender Registry
*Sex offender treatment is up to his agent
*No contact with any minors unless consent is provided by his agent
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with the victim or her family or residence
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COURT COSTS:  $268 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME:  1 year huber, released for work, school and physcial treatment
Defendant to report 07/21/2016 by 6 pm. 

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on July 21, 2016 at 09:30 am.
